title: Google Meet mic not working in Firefox for unknown reason
content:
So, this issue randomly started about a week ago and I've been scratching my head about it ever since, trying to find a solution. I don't know if it coincided with a Firefox upgrade, but I don't think so.

Here's the deal; in Firefox, when I go into google meets, my microphone and camera both show up as turned off with an exclamation mark, meaning I can't turn them on. This is my desktop PC and it has no camera, so the camera I understand. It definitely DOES have a microphone and I've used it many times.

The permission for "use the microphone" is set to allowed. When I click the exclamation mark on the camera, I get a popup saying "meet is blocked from using your camera". When I click the exclamation mark on the microphone button, my audio cuts out for a second, but other than that nothing happens - no popup, no explanation, nothing.

Other apps that use the microphone (i.e.; Teams) work just fine. Same browser, same permissions, same microphone. Microphone test sites also work just fine, so it's not a browser issue.

Using Google Meet in a different browser with the same microphone works just fine. I've tried Chrome and Opera - both work as expected.

On my other PC, a laptop, Google Meet with the same version of Firefox works just fine. So this must be some weird issue related to specifically my desktop.

Here is what I have tried so far; - Remove the mic permissions and set them again. - Clear all cookies, local storage, everything the browser has for this domain. - Turn off all extensions in the browser. - Restart browser, restart PC. - A combination of all of the above (remove permission, local storage, cookies, turn off extensions, close browser, restart PC, then start from scratch).

None of it makes any difference and I'm out of ideas. Does anyone know what the issue might be?

I previously posted this question on Google Meets support and the only reply I got was to try Firefox support... so here we are.
creator: fahr

title: Black frames around videos
content:
Hello everyone,

i just wanted to post this here so others may find it via google. I had a problem with videos randomly playing with black borders. That was really annoying because sometimes it cut out portions of the video. But after months of trying and searching nothing came out, except the "fullscreen black border 'api-config' fix" wich didn't help me. And now finally I figured it out! It was my damn AMD driver...! It was set to "Home Video" in "Audio and Video", wich enabled "AMD video stabilization".

So in quick summary: When you have black borders while watching video in Firefox; make sure in your AMD-driver, in "Audio and Video", "AMD video stabilization" is turned off!.

Hope this helps someone, bye :-).
creator: passcalmueller

content: Recently i have been unable to make a payment by credit card as the box for entering numbers is not activated or allowing entering numbers. I was also unable to access my account on Easyjet web site so had to Microsoft Edge.

title: tab issue when using virtual desktop
content: I have desktop 1 which is the main desktop where I have the static tabs and set to open with last tabs, I open the virtual desktop (desktop 2) and only use for random things, I always close the virtual desktop first then the main one, but when I open firefox the next day it opens with the desktop 2 tabs. How can I set Firefox to open with desktop 1 tabs? thank you

title: Profanity
content:
So recently i downloaded Mozilla firefox on windows vista which is a old version and i had also downloaded the same version on windows 10 now the problem is that the browser in both the computers are using profanity such as "porn" i am 15 and i am not Ecstatic and now when i try to delete it i cant its using way too many vulnerable language and also it says welcome humans we come in peace and I had downloaded from this site "https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/new/". That is my problem i hope u find a solution and ping me on my mail. Because of which my laptop is not even running. After this incident i dont even know if i will use mozilla any more. Thank you

Regards

Kairav

title: How to step up an upgrade to keep passwords
content: Hi. I have version 99 and need to upgrade to the latest. When i tried, the saved passwords dont show up. What versions to i need to upgrade to first to step it up with the passwords and where are links for those older versions? Thanks

title: I can't view the webpage I need.
content:
I am trying to go to a webpage but I can't the page content correctly as I do on my phone or ipad. Do I have to use Firefox? Is an update needed...my computere says I'm using an updated version. Help! It's important for my son's HS project and deadline is tomorrow.

thank you.
creator: bmcceney

title: Bookmarks bar disappearing apparently still an issue after 12 years.
content:
I searched the forums, and it appears this issue has answers going back 12 years.

Answers explain how to get it to show up again. Basically, it amounts to turning the bar off and back on again.

The problem is it WILL happen again. Why? It's been 12 years and no explanation as to why it happens or how to fix it permanently.

None of the Firefox updates over the years have addressed this either.
creator: dexluther

title: Screen recorder
content:
I'm looking for a screen recorder. The addon search list has several.

Awesome screenshot has a lot of users, but some aren't thrilled that you have to create an account.

it doesn't have to be particularly fancy. For instance, I have a couple Firefox and Windows issues I'd like t document.
creator: noel_envoide
